title.@value: Herpes simplex infection of central nervous system

definition.@value: A condition of the central nervous system, caused by an infection with herpes simplex virus (human herpesviruses 1 and 2). This condition is characterised by fever, headache, or other clinical symptoms depending on the site of infection. Confirmation is by identification of herpes simplex virus type 1 or 2.

label.@value: Herpes simplex infection of central nervous system
Herpes simplex encephalitis, myelitis or encephalomyelitis
